summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a BOP employee (Material Handler) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding his work on August 9, 2019, the night Jeffrey Epstein died. The employee describes exhaustion, procedural lapses like missed counts and falsified rounds, and interactions with other officers in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

persons.name: Amanda Moore
persons.context: Present for the interview of the BOP employee and is listed as the investigating agent who drafted the report.

persons.name: Omar Daza
persons.context: Present for the interview of the BOP employee from the Office of the Inspector General.

persons.name: Rebekah Donaleski
persons.context: Present for the interview, advised the employee about the voluntary nature of the interview and went over a proffer agreement.

persons.name: Nicolas
persons.context: Present for the interview of the BOP employee.

persons.name: Perez
persons.context: Called the employee on August 9, 2019, and asked/pressured him to work overtime in the SHU.

persons.name: Silvia
persons.context: Was called to the SHU on August 9, 2019, around 7:30pm to handle two inmates who threatened to hang themselves.

persons.name: Davis
persons.context: Worked the 4pm-12am shift in the SHU with the employee and Officer Noel on August 9, 2019. Left at 10pm. The employee spoke with him after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: Worked the 4pm-12am shift in the SHU with the employee and Officer Davis on August 9, 2019. Was the SHU officer and likely filled out round sheets. The employee spoke with her twice after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who died in the SHU. The document details his return to his cell around 8pm on August 9, being fed, and being alone in his cell after his cellmate left.

persons.name: Bullock
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the employee did not see in the SHU on the night of August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: Came in to relieve the employee at the end of his shift (12am) on August 9/10, 2019.

persons.name: Isaboro
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the officers who got in trouble in 2017 for not doing rounds, which led to stricter enforcement of round documentation.

persons.name: Ortiz
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the officers who got in trouble in 2017 for not doing rounds, which led to stricter enforcement of round documentation.

connections.description: Worked together on the SHU shift on August 9, 2019. The employee states they are friends and spoke twice after Epstein's death.
Worked together on the SHU shift on August 9, 2019. The employee spoke with Davis after Epstein's death.
Lieutenant Perez called and pressured the employee to work overtime in the SHU on August 9, 2019.
Both were Corrections Officers working the same SHU shift with the employee on August 9, 2019.
Both are mentioned as officers who got in trouble together in 2017 for not conducting rounds.

events.title: Epstein's Last Night in SHU
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is returned to his cell in the SHU's L-Tier around 8pm, is fed a kosher meal, and is left alone after his cellmate had left. Officers missed the 10pm institutional count.

events.title: Suicide Threat in SHU
events.description: Two inmates in the same cell on L-Tier threaten to hang themselves. Acting Lieutenant Silvia is called, and the inmates are placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Missed 10pm Institutional Count
events.description: The mandatory 10pm inmate count in the SHU was not conducted. Officers were tired and no one explicitly said they wouldn't do it, but it was skipped.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is found dead in his cell. The employee calls Officer Noel after finding out.

events.title: FBI Interview of BOP Employee
events.description: A BOP Material Handler is interviewed by the FBI and OIG regarding procedures and events at MCC on and before August 9, 2019.

events.title: Enforcement of Round Documentation
events.description: After officers Isaboro and Ortiz got in trouble for not doing rounds, MCC began enforcing written documentation of 30-minute rounds.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
United States Attorneys Office (USAO), Southern District of New York (SDNY), 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York
Federal Law Enforcement Training Center (FLETC), Glynco, GA
keyFacts: The interviewed BOP employee admitted that officers, including himself, sometimes falsified 30-minute round logs, writing that rounds were conducted when they were not.
The mandatory 10pm institutional inmate count in the SHU on August 9, 2019, the night Epstein died, was not conducted.
Jeffrey Epstein was alone in his cell on the night of August 9, 2019, after his cellmate had been released, contrary to protocol given his prior suicide attempt.
The employee described a culture of exhaustion at MCC, with officers working 3-4 mandated overtime shifts per week, leading to burnout and procedural corners being cut.
Officer Noel, who was on duty with the employee that night, was described as scared and reluctant to talk about the events in conversations after Epstein's death.
